title: Drawing, "Contemporary American Industrial Design Exhibition, Metropolitan Museum of Art, 1934: Dining Table", October 2, 1934
medium: Graphite and black ink on tracing paper
markings: Stamp in black ink, lower right: DONALD DESKEY/501 MADISON AVENUE/ NEW YORK CITY
inscribed: Inscribed in graphite in stamp, lower right: 6085 - SPEC./F.S./METR. MUSEUM/CAL. REDWOOD BURR/POL. CHROM./ETCHED MIRROR TOP/REFLECTOR; Olsson/D./10/2/34; 10/3/34, 1, SHK/10/6/34, 1, PITTSBURG GLASS/10/6/34, 1, MET.; dimensions, materials, instructions in graphite
description: Perspective, plan, and elevation drawings for dining room table. Rectangular top of table in etched mirror glass, reflector light at center underneath etched glass. Apron of table top with polished chrome trim and California redwood burr. Four strap metal polished chrome legs in U-shape, with polished chrome strap metal stretcher at lower center. Legs on base at left and right of California redwood burr.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Contemporary American Industrial Design Exhibition, Metropolitan Museum of Art, 1934: Dining Table", October 2, 1934.
October 2, 1934. Graphite and black ink on tracing paper. Gift of Donald Deskey. 1975-11-717.
